result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph C Banks

records.addlTxt:
Pre- trail 11/4/22 at 10:40 AM
Return date 11/21/22 at 9:00 AM

Standard felony conditions
Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia.

12:53 PM Defendant Joseph C Banks appeared by video, in custody from the Columbia county jail.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II appeared by video for Joseph C Banks.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. waived reading of criminal complaint, right to attorney recited, $1,000.00 signature bond, standard felony conditions, Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. waived time limits for Preliminary hearing. 1:23 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Return date scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
